content.description: Transition of Power is a low problem and a good warm-up on sharp hands and ok feet. We were likely not the FA, but we don't know who is.
content.location: On the South side of the Nubble, this is the first boulder you come to. The route faces the parking area. Sit start on an obvious hand rail/jug, and move up the face on sharp jugs.

climbs.name: Pirate's Booby
climbs.fa: Unsure, maybe me, but I doubt it.

content.description: This is the obvious crack leading up the center of the boulder. The FA is unknown, maybe me?
content.protection: This could be protected with a couple of cams in the 1 to 3 inch range, or you could just bring a pad to cover the jagged rocks below. I did it with nothing and scared my mom half to death.
content.location: On the harbor side of the nubble is a large and obvious cracked boulder. Pirate's Booby is the crack.

content.description:
At the mouth of the Westport Harbor lies The Nubble. In the 1600s, pirates used this large granite outcropping to hide their ships from unsuspecting ships looking for a natural port. 

  Although most of the Nubble is class 4, there are a few steep boulders on the harbor (northern) side of the Nubble. There may be as many as 20 moderate to hard problems in the areas. 

  The ascent history of the boulders on this rock is unclear.
